content: baby walrus wally is part of project arctic in project arctic i crochet different animals that live on or around the poles they may live on the ice in the air or in the water what makes those animals special is that many of them have a very different appearance when they re young compared to when they are grown up and that is very nice to crochet did you know that the walrus teeth grow up to 1 meter now that is big teeth **size** the walrus will be about 15 cm long and 10 cm wide **materials** 1 ball durable cosy fine teddy 342 leftover black cotton or embroidery thread for the nose 2 safety eyes 7 mm black stuffing 4 mm crochet hook us g/6 yarn needle **related patterns** if you like to crochet the other patterns of project arctic have a look at my ravelry store 1 for example it might be fun to crochet wally s father ward the walrus 2 1 https //www ravelry com/stores/haakneus-designs 2 https //www ravelry com/patterns/library/ward-the-walrus
